spatialplanr 0.0.1.0001
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Function to create square or heaxagonal planning units for your area of interest.

    SpatPlan_Get_PlanningUnits.Rd

    The code takes the bbox so the limits are the most important. The output inherits the crs from this sf object so ensure it is in the correct projection for your needs The code assumes that any Planning Unit whose centroids is over land will be removed. This approximates > 50% of the PU is landward.

    Usage

    SpatPlan_Get_PlanningUnits(
  Bndry,
  InnerB,
  CellArea = 1000,
  Shape = "hexagon",
  inverse = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    Bndry

    An sf polygon object which outlines the limits of the study area.

    InnerB

    An sf multipolygon object which contains all the areas (ie land) that you wish to remove from the grid.

    CellArea

    The area in km you wish your resultant Planning Units to be.

    Shape

    Hexagon or Square

    inverse

    To invert the InnerB and keep the areas within the InnerB

    Value

    An sf object of planning units

    Details

    Some example options for hexagonal PU_size PU_size <- 5240 # km2 (~1 deg at equator) PU_size <- 2620 # km2 (~0.5 deg at equator) PU_size <- 669.9 # km2 (~0.25 deg at equator)

    Written by Jason Everett (UQ/UNSW/CSIRO) Written: 15 December 2020 Updated: 8th April 2022
